column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column8: Tour Guide's Review: Unwind at Beruwala Beach
column11: As a tour guide with extensive experience across Sri Lanka‚Äôs coastline, Beruwala Beach is a standout destination for those seeking a serene and picturesque escape. Located on the western coast, this beach offers a charming blend of natural beauty and cultural richness, making it a must-visit for travelers looking to experience the best of Sri Lanka's beach life.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: We stayed at The Palms Hotel in Beruwala and soon as you go out on the beach, if you go to the left, you  come to the first shack. There is a man there, Sisiya Bandula, who has helped us with lots of things. We hired Tuk Tuk with him to take us to Aluthgama and have a look around the various shops there. You can also tell the driver to take you to a certified place to Change any currency at a much better rate. Another day,  the Tuk Tuk  driver took us to a Turtle Hatchery in Kosgoda, which was fascinating and informative. From there, he took us to a private Moonstone mine and that was mind blowing. We were there and saw the whole procedure, of when they bring the stones, up from the mine, till it's polished and made into jewellery.  That half a day trip, all for 8000RS, plus hatchery admission fee. He can arrange a Massage for you for around 6500RS. There are two that I highly recommend, Mantra or Suwa Asapuwa Ayurveda. They will really look  after you. Our Beruwala holiday was an experience of a lifetime

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: the mosque is built at the spot where the first Muslim Arab traders landed and subsequently settled in the area. It is believed that a vessel carrying seven members of the royal family of Hadhramaut, Yemen came ashore at this location. They included the Sultan Ashraff Waliullah, his five brothers and a sister. When Waliullah died in 1024 AD he was buried in a tomb on the hill. Allegedly one day, when the chief of the Masjid Al-Abrar in Beruwala was cleaning the tomb he stepped on a sharp thorn following which he rest under a tree and fell asleep. During his slumber, Waliullah appeared as a vision and sought that a mosque be built where his tomb was. At that time the site was known as ‚ÄúUtchchamalai‚Äù in Tamil, which translates to ‚Äúhigh hill‚Äù, over time this was modified to its current name of Ketchchimalai The current building was constructed in 1911 by a wealthy Muslim businessman. It is essentially a squarish white building, with an ornate arched exterior, curving dutch-style gables, with an unusual domed minaret crowned with a crescent-and-star ornament. Outside the mosque but within its grounds are the graves of two imams (father and son) and a madrasa. The mosque is the focus for a major Eid al-Fitr festival held at the end of Ramadan, with large numbers of pilgrims attending. On 12 June 2015 the mosque was declared a protected archaeological site by the government.[4]

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: This was my sec–ænd time in Beruwala. I dont like a beach rest, but I wanted to see Beach Corner again. Why ? Cause of my friends ! These are really kindly, honest and friendly men. They helped me and my family everywhere. My friend Ranga made a gift for my dauther - sapphire. My friend Yuri always took care about me and my family. My friend Shan organized fishing and other tours, he is a touristic manager. And everything was for good price or free, because we are friends ! Now they have a little restaraunt on Beach Corener (look at the map in my photos). Very tasty seafood and honest prices ! Wellcome !

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Came back to visit this beach as we stayed here on our first visit to Sri Lanka. Not changed much still dirty and scruffy in places which is a shame as could be really stunning, the locals need to be like the Thai/Malaysian people and take pride in their beaches and come out and clean them up on a daily basis, but with the beaches having no sunbeds on them this is why they are left and debris washes up and collects on the beach. It still has very rough waves and big ones at times. Nice long beach to walk on and still many hawkers trying to sell you their items or just wanting to walk with you. Sea is clean and views are nice. Not many cafes/bars to stop for a drink as all inclusive has put them out of business so do take refreshments with you.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The beach was kept clean outside of our hotel and it streched for quite a way that eventually reached the river if which you can take a boat trip .The sea was quite rough when we were there and always had the red flag flying , you could still enter the sea , but was a bit too dangerous if you went too far out ,The sea was as warm as bath water and clear unless churned up by storms , The scenery was very lush with palm trees and a few sellers with stalls which sold clothes along the way ,i had some made to measure trousers by a seller on beach called Daniel Tailors and very good massage attached next to the tailors too . I can thouroughly recommend along from The Palms Hotel too SIRI { we affectionatly called him PAPPA} who arranged all of our trips to places of interest and his driver SID , they will come and find you on the beach , very reasonable prices for the places we visited and always there for us and made us 4 woman feel safe too There are a lot of stray dogs on the beach

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The beach was very calm with hardly any waves which was around 7.00 a.m. We could walk quite far into the sea. However, as the sun grew hot the water rose abut six inches but that was it. It was luxurious to wade in the water as the reef encloses that area giving it a pool effect and making it safe and fun. The sand was warm and clean. There were lots of shops along the beach catering to tourists. We will be going to sea bathing again this Saturday 28th January. However this type of weather will end in and around March when the monsoon begins.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The beach is very nice. You can go for a walk outside but when you are outside there wait a lot of people who want to sell you tours and souvenirs. Some of them can be really disturbing. We bought a tour by Henry with entries and lunch, we wondered us why it is so expensive but we had to pay for every sightseeing subject before by our round tour so we taught this will be alright. But after the tour they didn't paid lunch and they didn't had to pay entries so it was much to expensive. So our tip if you want to make a tour book it with pickme app or by a locale taxi driver but not by these guys who wait in front of the hotel.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Very Nice and clean beach...has rock / coral break for the waves...water placid on one side of the beach....clean sand.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: My self and my husband stayed at the Eden hotel which was fantastic and it's right on the Beruwela beach which is beautiful it's cleaned most days but you have to be careful in the sea because there is a strong current  which goes into Bentota river but there are red and yellow flags put in the sand to tell you which part of sea is ok to swim also there is a lifeguard at the Eden sat in a tower also further along the beach is lifeguards and there own watch tower with public toilets so it's a lovely beach from Dianne Stevens from Derbyshire England

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Amazing clear waters, clean and safe, hotels nearby for cooling refreshments or simply buy a king cocnut of one of the beach vendors

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: This was near a mosque it was beautiful the locals were friendly and there was so much Serenity ... I could sit in a rock all day I felt They had ice cream and mangoes :) what more can I ask for It was a great beach not many tourists just the locals The beach was rough this day I lost my flip flops but it was all worth it Beautiful blessed beach near the mosque

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The sand is really Golden color. You can walk miles along the beach with out any obstacles. Many places to relax and there is a reef so it is safe to swin for the children.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beach has very nice tidal waves but harmless as the water level is low and the beach is in a curved shape. You can play in the beach as well as in water. Also you can have a nice swim if you walk a bit into the sea. You get nice sunrise and sunset. If you go early around 6am, you can see the fishermen sailing their boats towards sea.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Pretty beach to look at and interesting to watch fishermen and daily life of the locals. In front of where I stayed was very clean because the owners kept it that way. However very sad to see the plastic pollution in the water and on the shore. Overall a nice beach to visit and perhaps a picnic.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Bentota is really a lovely place for vacation lovers - Good hotels make the stay even more pleasurable. Water sports offered in Laluna are better priced than anywhere else. Guys in Tuk Tuk really can take you to diff places and help you find best prices of all water sports. Tuk Tuk guys here are very friendly and helpful, also genuine!

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Depending on the season the water quality can be different due to the nearby Bentota River, boats take you the other side where the water is much clearer

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beautiful, tranquil, safe and even option to swim with a separate natural area shaped like a swimming pool. Loved the water, sand.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Too many rocks and all times waves. Not good for swimming. And overall view comparing with the Kata beach at Phuket, Thailand are not good...

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

May also look up home stays to avoid costly Hotels. There are some on the river front also overlooking the mouth of the river meeting the ocean. Fabulous must do place.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Not that good as Hikkaduwa, Unawatuna or Bentota, the beach water is not that clean and bit smelly. The coral reef in front of the Cinnamon Bay Beruwela is amazing

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Good place to go with your kids and enjoy sending kites and dip in the sea which is protected by the Reef.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Our hotel surrounded by the Sea. Where one part was quite silent and other part was with full of waves. The breeze and the sunset will make you feel very relaxed. I throughly enjoyed the feeling including my family. But you get the hawkers who will disrupt once in a while.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beach is beautiful with no words to explain.Sunset was a miracle with the golden cloudy sky. The day we went there it was a red flag which means it's not safe to swim.It's a must to check whether the waves are safe before enjoying.All the hotels have this flag at their beach entrance. People were seems to be friendly but we felt bit unsecured during the night since few beach boys were trying to talk to us.In my opinion it's always good to avoid those strangers.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beruwala Beach :- I have seen many changes on this beach over the past 18 years. It's still as beautiful but far more tranquil than it used to be. There used to be quite a lot of beach shacks selling lots of different things. However the beach boys are still there, just older and wiser. I still take the same photos year after year to notice the change. This is a friendly beach with lots of locals and not so many tourists unless it's busy. It's perfectly safe to go on a trip with the guys from the beach as they are registered with the tourist board. SHAN is a great guy and knows many places to take tourists at a fraction of the hotel prices. He usually sits outside the Lanka princess hotel . Trustworthy and honest. The beach is stunning. Just what u imagine a tropical beach to be. The Indian Ocean in this area is choppy with a terribly strong undercurrent. Be careful.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Nice beach clean and tidy. Lovely warm waters and a good number of hotels along the front to stop off for a drink.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The sea is normally on the rougher side, swiming not advised (and red flagged most of the year, I understand) and there are no trees or other shade options. Sand quality good average. Sri Lanka has lots of better places....

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: A very long clean white sandy beach  but not so good for swimming waves were high and strong undertow

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Very long and wide beach with wonderful sand so take your sandals off! Surprise nature gifts are found throughout your walk like sundried seeds, coral parts and sea shells. It was windy the day we visited so the sea was not appealing but you could see fishermen in the middle of the sea as there appeared to be a reef which also served as a wave stopper. Lots of small places by the beach to drink or grab a snack but many locals bothering you in a kind but stacking way. It was the only downside..

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beach is lovely but too many people try to sell you things rather than let you walk and enjoy the peace!

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Perfect place to have a cold beer, with your feet in the sand and watch the sunset. (Also, as a bit of a treat, I thoroughly recommend the chips/fries which reminded me of the best of the UK style)

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Nice and clean beach there is nice reef covered by natural swimming pool  the mining very nice to have walk in beach  very nice view from cinnamon bey

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

There are a few small islands and there is an option of a boat tour. There are sea food restaurants backed into the beach.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

The sand is lovely and soft. Despite the big waves, the water is very shallow until you get quite far out. We loved it here.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The beach here is one of the most beautiful beaches that I have ever seen in my life. It has two island about a kilometer offshore that provide amazing photo oppertunities. The water here is crystal clear and easy to swim in. The beach itself is a couple of kilometers long and so is excellent for taking strolls in especially during dusk since it is really romantic. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone visiting Sri Lanka, as a matter of fact it's my favorite thing about Sri Lanka.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Great beach. A little more livelier  than Bentota with locals selling their wares and just trying to earn a living or even a meal for the family. Spare a little thought before u dismiss the pedlars on the beach. Don't be rude,,,,, like everyone else they are just trying to do their job. If you want to go on a tour I think in my opinion u should ask for Shan ,he's usually found outside Lanka princess. Hes s good honest guy. I have known him for 17 years.he will not overcharge and will look after you. A trip to the green shade coffee shop is a great place to see the rest of the beach from.watch the world go by. Upul is a waiter at the coffee shop and a great guy. Should start to get a little busier once the new hotel is finished but nothing much will change. Enjoy yourself, relax and go with the flow x

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

Special fond memories for ever !!

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Here is a lot of specific information based on personal experience. I wish I had this knowledge before our trip. I hope it will help you people to plan, enjoy your trip and make your holidays much enjoyable and easy going. 2 days trip from Beruwala: Royal Botanic Gardens as well as Spice garden was on our route way to Kandy. Our first point of 2 days trip was Elephant Orphanage, I recommend you to go there, the elephants are amazing. It is also interesting to see how they make the paper from elephant's "droppings" (sorry), you can also buy some in their shop, it is kind of popular ). The ticket to the orphanage cost $20/person + some extra options if you want to feed or wash them etc. (one more surprising tip: you officially will pay extra money in all those places of interest, for example in Elephant Orphanage if you are not a local or from some Arabic country ($10) or Africa ($5). It was one of the negative experiences), not cheap but the Elephants are definitely worth it. Than we had the Royal Botanic Gardens, if you plan to go there give it some more time, it is rather big and very beautiful. The Spice garden is rather small but it was interesting to listen about the plants they have. But, again, this is the place where they consider you as a bag with money. Be careful to try some treatments they offer in their "showroom" for free! (my friend was ready to give a good sum of money to the guy who did him a head massage with some herbal oil?), at the end they take you to their shop where you can buy some oil and herbal's they just advertised, but guess what.. the prices in the shop 3 or even 4 times higher than the real price (by the way there are nice pharmacy shop right in Beruwala if you are interested to buy some handmade coconut oil, etc. It is located by road if you go by tuk-tuk from the hotel to Bentota beach, next to the fish-seafood market before the bridge). After that we get to the Tooth Temple in Kandy, we had a different guide there for the Temple tour - 1,500 rupees for the guide (if you decide to have this tour you should have some cover for your legs to be able to get inside, be sure you have it with you or be ready to pay for a rent). Than we had a night in Kandy. Very busy day. It took about 200 km from Beruwala to Kandy but in Sri Lanka it feels more like 400 km. road traffic is a total mess. I consider it as a disadvantage of our 2 days trip. Second day we had a beautiful mountain views, breathtaking waterfall and Mackwoods Tea Factory. Second day was a different and the road back took to much time. It is about 300 km from Kandy to Nuwara Eliya and then back to Beruwala but the road traffic even worth because 70% of the route was on the mountains. We start our trip from hotel at 4:00 in the morning and back to the hotel next day about 10:00 PM. We choose the places by ourselves, you can do the same and pick the only places you want to visit. We also had plans to go to Gale Fort and I have prepared to do the tour by myself but we didn't manage to get there. I even planned to go there by local train to feel the difference and contrast. Entertainment: Regarding restaurants/cafes, I don't think you can find a really good one in there at all. If you will it might be as good as expensive. This experience was kind of culture shock to us. I wont comment it any longer, you should see and feel it by yourself. For every person it is different. They have several very good restaurants at the hotel but the price was to expensive for us. It is also couple of cafes at the beach side, we used to eat at Sasha ones and ordered to take away some sea food, coral fish from Sunflower.. it was okay but, again, the price is not reasonable. They also have some kind of water trunk with live lobsters at Sunflower, 6,000-7,000 rupees/kg, 2 pcs per kg. Just to compare with market price - 2,500-4,000 rupees/kg. But you need to be able to bargain very hard to get a good price. Like I mentioned in my reviews the best option for us was to buy any seafood at the local market place not far from the hotel and pay for cooking it at the nearest sea side cafe (next to the hotel, left side if you look at the ocean). We used this option our last evening, the food was just perfect, we had about 6 kg of food for 4 person (2 big dorada fish - highly recommended, big prawns and 4 lobsters but I'd rather buy some more prawns instead of lobster), all this cost us around $70. I believe it could be even lower if we had some local person we could trust to buy it for us. IMPORTANT tips: Here are some general tips you need to be aware of and prepared for. - The level of humidity everywhere in Sri Lanka is very high especially at the coastal side of the island, combine it with high temperature and "curry" smell everywhere. In couple of days the hair and skin will be soaked with that smell. - I'd rather not trust anyone outside the hotel despite you guide if you manage to trust him. Almost every person you might meet will try to cheat on you, as long as you don't know the language and your skin color is white - you are just a bag with money to local people, especially to beach boys, they will make money on you in every place you visit with them. - The first questions, after "-hello, how are you", you would be asked while walking the beach would be like: "-where are you from?", "which hotel you stay?" and "-for how long you are going to stay?" !! these questions are allow them to identify how much money they can get from you. For example if you stay for a very short period of time the price whatever they offer will be higher. And the opposite if you stay much longer. some kind of discount because the offer can be done couple of times. ) something like that. - Always check the quality of seafood before it is bought or cooked, especially if you are going to order it in cafe, the smell should be more fresh and the fish gills color should be more lite rosy. Because of the high temperature seafood could spoil faster. When we ordered some food from sunflower to take away, they were offering us not fresh coral fish, after I pointed at the dark and bed smell gills they brought me the same one but totally fresh! I also went to see how they cook it to make sure it is the one we ordered. - If you want to try some local alcohol drinks (like arak or red rum), there are only one place in Beruwala you can buy it but you better ask the guide to buy it for you. The same principal is always there. The price is also indicated by producer right on the bottle you just need to find it but.. the price can rise for you up to 30-40%. The quality is also vary. - Real price for the bottle of the Lion bear is 180 rupees (check on the bottle). I also recommend you to try a ginger bear, it is non alcohol but it is very good. - Real price for a coconut (yellow, orange coconut) is about 25-40 rupees. And it is better to chill it before you drink it. You can use the refrigerator in the room to make it cold. - If you like milk products you should try their local curd, it is available at the "supermarket" in a big pottery dish jar. - If you need a tuk-tuk (to go to the shop, pharmacy, local temple, Bentota beach etc.) I recommend you to take it near the hotel, not far from the hotel gate take left, there are guys with blue shorts. The price for round trip starts from 400 rupees but you can drop it to 200-300 rupees. The beach boys offer even lower price for 100 but be careful their purpose is only to hook you up first. With the very best wishes to all of you guys who find this info helpful ! Have a Happy Holiday )

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: We have just come home after a wonderful holiay at the Palms Hotel Beruwala. Our holiday started the moment we stepped out of the car to be greeted by Ruchira and her lovely staff a welcomed cup of tea was waiting for us Then to our favouite room as usual immaculate fresh and cleaned by Nandana and a lovely bouquet of flowers from Kanthi the Housekeeper a wonderful start to our 4 weeks holiday.We cannot give enough praise for this Hotel every member of staff so very helpful and friendly. Our visits now go imto two figures we love it there and our next visit will be Jan 2016..

column11: This was very interesting indeed. the turtles lay eggs on the beach. these are retrieved and brought to a safe place where they are hatched. then the turtles are released into the sea when they grow to a particular size.

column11: Red flag every day for 7 days. Very strong currents so unable to swim in sea so dangerous for children. However, lovely sandy beach and water was clear and warm.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The Beach is nice to the part from Ypsylon towards Alutgama. The other part is just filthy. Good place to take a walk but every local person there is trying to sell something or generally get money from you with any method possible and that is very frustrating in the end. When they are not there or when they are busy with somebody else, beach is nice - especially late in the evening. Swimming and snorkeling are not bad either :)

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beautiful, so glad we got married on the beach. Lovely walks along the beach with little shops to have a look in.  A few restaurants  which we tried out nearly all of them, food was delicious, especially the seafood

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Excellent swimming and lifeguard on duty - with WARM sea. Not crowded just nicely sociable. Beach also cleaned every morning.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Lovely sand, clear water for safe swimming, uncrowded. Several bars and restaurants and a few small shops.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: stayed here in beruwala beach, at the sagrika beach hotel (fab little hotel) the sea can be a little rough with big waves, be careful with children although shallow theres a swell and the waves will hit you over the beach boys may pester you a little but they are ok, theres a lovely little restaurant called ( fresh) mid way along the beach just down from the few shops to the left looking at the sea, best beer and food prices, and excellent food, if you want to call home get a dialog sim card you can ring a land line back home for 2 rupee a min, or 15 rupee to a mobile for shopping go to food city alutgama return in a tuk tuk 2-300 rupee don't pay more

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Very wonderfull beach with gradual slope to the ocean. Beach is maintained.  The water is very clean and warm, always with waves. If you want to swim you have to go minimal 50 m to the ocean.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: A bit dissapointing, tbe sand was not clean and the sea was too rough as to enjoy of swimming there. It was a pity.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: We had a great time at this pleasant beach, near Fresh restaurant (recommended) and Sasika restaurant (not bad but not recommended). Wide, sandy beaches without rocks. Lots of wave surfing going around. During our visits, the beach itself was close to deserted. We consider this to be an advantage. Especially since most shops and restaurants are open despite the absence of large crowds. The beach maybe difficult to find but any three-wheeler driver can take you there.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: but not in front of the Hotel. It is dangerous to swim there. Walk some hundred meters and it becomes better - or you set over a small river and find a fantastic beach!!!

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The rip tide is strong where the river mouth meets the sea and unfortunately someone drown while we were there. It is best to keep to shallow water away from the river and be with someone to raise the alarm if you run into trouble. There are also traders that can pester you along the beach but they are trying to earn a living. Be polite but give a firm NO at the end of polite conversation. There are some very good guides out there and we were fortunate to meet one that put us first. He was there for us when we needed him. He took us shopping, took us on a 4 day trip and was kind enough to invite us back to his family for dinner one night. Be careful and follow you instinct. You could also mention a guides/traders name to hotel staff and see what they say.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The river open nearby and it is a dangerous beach to beach/sea to swim. Jet skis which are not regulated are frequent

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beach was excellent for walking, but kept being annoying by person trying to sell all sorts of things and difficult to get rid of as they wanted to talk.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beach is long and lovely, only problem is the washed up plastic items. All the hotels need to pool resources and have the beaches cleaned up.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Rough waters  uneven sea bed a bit extra tapered towards see and sharp rocks not a best place try ticonovalli or willigama beach they are non crowded and fun

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beruwala Beach Is Very Quite and Clear, With Few Small Beach Hotels serving Very Good Sea Food and Beer,  Not So Many PEOPLE To Disturb, A Pleasant Beach.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Nice beach to wander along.The sea here tends to be brown due to the sea churning up the sand and the Aluthgama River mouth. Do not go out of your depth to swim as the currents are strong and there is a drag. The locals now have a tractor and so the beach does get cleaned each morning. Also there are some shops & stalls with shells/sarongs etc for sale at the Eden Resort & Spa hotel end of the beach. The Blue Lagoon & Green Shade restaurants are good. Look out for Daniel Ayevurdic Massage for the best massage on Aluthgama beach. 25 mins back massage for 600 lkr. Nice room just off beach. Clean towels too. Kumar uses quality oils and creams. One other tip if you need a tuk-tuk, some shopping in the town or even a local excursion ask for Patte, a Sri Lanka tourism office guide who speaks German, English & Russian.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Beaches between Beruwala and Bentota are the most fine for safe swimming, there are no big waves and beautiful nature.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The beach at the hotel is not part of the hotel and is need of a tidy up. It is not safe to swim there, red flag out everyday we were there. As soon as you leave the hotel grounds you are accosted by locals trying to sell you something. Difficult to be left alone. However the tuk tuk drivers give good service at vewry reasonable prices.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: The beach is nice and clean Beruwala beach is approx 20kms away from the city Hikkawuda which is an ideal place for snorkelling, to see the corals and fishes from a glass bottom ship.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Great beach to walk along and see a little of local life. The sea was fairly churned up while we there as it was the end of the monsoons.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: lovely beach with fisherman are closed by. friendly locals but beware from the beach boys. boat rides are available at a low price. better be with your team.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: Area was good but the only trip I had worst food.If you like quality and choice of food ,and you enjoy the luxury of a holiday please dont visit The Palm

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: On first viewing the beach looks a little dangerous. The red flags make it clear not to swim. In September that seems to be all the time. In fact for about 100 metres/yards it is safe to paddle. The beach has a very gentle shelf that never seems to plunge or have rocks. There is a lagoon near the reef, that might catch out children so as always don't let them swim alone. The forceful sea does kick up the sand, the water seems clean.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: We visited the beach which was poor in relation to others in the world - it was full sellers/touts who promise you a ten minute tour of their shop (do not go with them, as they charge inflated prices). The best tactic to use is to tell them you are leaving the next day.

column2: Beruwala BeachSomeone from this business manages the listing.
column11: When travelling from Colombo on Galle road about 58 km s between Kalutara and Bentota you get world famoues GOLDEN mile beach or Beruwala Beach. This beach is very famous for its water sports culture. Water skiing, Wind surfing, Water scooter rides and swimming. The Beruwala Bay Beach is very safe to swim any day of the year. It is also famous among diving community too.
